Subjective: Left ear pain and sensation of water for 2-3 days; gradually worsening. Pain baseline 3-4/10, increases to 6-7/10 after showering. Hearing decreased in left ear. Impact: Unable to swim. Pertinent Negatives: No fever, feels generally well. Social History: Started swimming frequently a few weeks ago; cleans ears with cotton buds 3x/week. ICE: Wants to know what is wrong with ear; wants pain to stop; a little scared because left ear is not as good as right.
Objective: Vitals: Temp 36.2. Physical Exam: Right Ear: External canal clean, tympanic membrane normal. Left Ear: Pain on pinna manipulation. External auditory canal is red, swollen, and thick. Tympanic membrane not well visualized.
Plan: 1. Painkillers: Paracetamol up to 4000mg daily as needed. 2. Medication: Prescribed acidic, anti-inflammatory ear drops, 3 times daily for one week. 3. Lifestyle: Keep left ear dry for one week. Stop cleaning with cotton buds. 4. Follow-up: Return for consultation in one week.
